title: Ticket #1586: Fix cycle detection test or re-word 'cycle exists in the dag' message
description: The "cycle exists in the dag" error message can get generated by a bunch of errors that are not actually cycles. We should either fix the code that generates this error message, or at least change the message to something like "an error (possibly a cycle) exists in the dag".
remarks:
2010-Aug-18 10:21:46 by psilord:
I'm pretty sure cycle detection isn't rocket science, why is it off at all and why could it possibly be wrong--it is a totally determinable solution!

2010-Aug-18 10:28:07 by wenger:
We do have an actual cycle detection test, but it's pretty slow. I guess one solution might be to run that test when we get an error that might be a cycle.
2010-Oct-27 16:39:01 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070404 to v070405 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2011-Jan-12 17:41:08 by wenger:
Committed code fix for this -- leaving the ticket open because I haven't fixed the version history yet.

2011-Jan-13 13:11:40 by wenger:
This is now documented in the version history, so I'm going to resolve the ticket.
